test_results.input: How do authentication, time, and source details ensure electronic signature integrity?
test_results.actual_output:
Authentication, time, and source details are crucial for ensuring the integrity of electronic signatures. These elements are captured by electronic signature software and serve several purposes:

1. **Authentication**: This confirms the identity of the person signing the document, ensuring that the signature is genuine and belongs to the correct individual. It helps in verifying that the document was signed with the signatory's full knowledge and agreement [filing-documents-with-electronic-signatures.html].

2. **Time Details**: Recording the time when the signature was applied ensures that the document's signing is traceable and can be verified as having occurred at a specific moment. This helps in maintaining the document's authenticity and accuracy, as it shows that no amendments were made after the signature was added unless clearly marked [filing-documents-with-electronic-signatures.html].

3. **Source Details**: These details indicate where the signature originated, providing an additional layer of verification. It ensures that the document was signed using the appropriate software and that the signature was not tampered with or copied from another source [filing-documents-with-electronic-signatures.html].

These details must be maintained in their original form within the software and can be provided upon request to demonstrate the validity of the electronic signature. This process helps prevent disputes over the authenticity of the signature and ensures compliance with legal standards [filing-documents-with-electronic-signatures.html].
test_results.expected_output: Authentication, time, and source details ensure electronic signature integrity by providing a verifiable record of who signed the document, when it was signed, and where the signature originated. This information is captured and maintained in its original form within the electronic signature software, ensuring that the document is authentic and has not been altered after signing. These details help confirm that the signature was applied with the signer's full knowledge and agreement, and any changes made post-signature are clearly marked, thereby safeguarding the integrity of the signed document.
context:
Where a document with your electronic signature has been filed with us, you must use electronic signature software that captures authentication, time and source details.
       

       
        These details must be held within the software itself, in the form of a file that:
       

       	
         is maintained in its original form with no amendments, and
        
	
         can be provided to us, if requested, within a specified time.
        


       
        Controlling when and how your signature is used
       

       
        Once a document with your electronic signature has been filed with us, we consider the information:
       

       	
         has been provided with your full knowledge and agreement
        
	
         is authentic and accurate
        
	
         wasn't amended after your electronic signature was added to the document, unless a change has been clearly marked on the document.
        


       
        You're responsible for:
       

       	
         safeguarding how and when your electronic signature and credentials are used on documents and information
        
	
         managing who has authority to use your electronic signature on your behalf, for example, a chartered accountant.
        


       
        
        
        
         
         
        
        
         Important
retrieval_context: filing-documents-with-electronic-signatures.html: Where a document with your electronic signature has been filed with us, you must use electronic signature software that captures authentication, time and source details.                          These details must be held within the software itself, in the form of a file that:                 	          is maintained in its original form with no amendments, and          	          can be provided to us, if requested, within a specified time.                            Controlling when and how your signature is used                          Once a document with your electronic signature has been filed with us, we consider the information:                 	          has been provided with your full knowledge and agreement          	          is authentic and accurate          	          wasn't amended after your electronic signature was added to the document, unless a change has been clearly marked on the document.                            You're responsible for:                 	          safeguarding how and when your electronic signature and credentials are used on documents and information          	          managing who has authority to use your electronic signature on your behalf, for example, a chartered accountant.                                                                                              Important

filing-documents-with-electronic-signatures.html: If your electronic signature on a document or information is filed with us, you won't be able to dispute having signed and approved the document or information.                     If we question the authenticity of an electronic signature or online transaction, you must be able to demonstrate on request the validity of the software used to apply your electronic signature to the document.                                              Keeping records                          When signing documents electronically, please make sure you follow our standard for using electronic signatures.                 	                     Standard for the use of a valid electronic signature on documents                                      The file must be treated as a record, as defined by the                   Companies Act 1993                                                                                , and a business record as defined by the                   Evidence Act 2006                                                                                .                          Avoiding rejection                          Be aware that your documents signed electronically will be rejected if they:                 	          have signatures that have been cut and pasted, or created using a touch screen, and          	          didn’t capture authentication, time and source details at the time of applying an electronic signature (when using a software), or

filing-documents-with-electronic-signatures.html: ‘Electronic signature’, in relation to information in electronic form, means a method used to identify a person and to indicate that person’s approval of that information.                                                                                                                                                      Contract and Commercial Law Act 2017                                  New Zealand Legislation                                                                                                                                  When you can use an electronic signature                          The Companies Office accepts electronic signatures on the following types of documents on the Companies Register:                 	          financial statements          	          director consents          	          shareholder consents          	          directors’ certificates for issue of shares or options          	          resolutions of solvency          	          notices of proposed compromise          	          amalgamations.                            You can only file documents and information with us using an electronic signature if you're the signatory, or have authority to act on behalf of the signatory, and are:                 	          using one of our online services, and          	          using software that complies with our standards, in particular keeping records of transactions where an electronic signature has been used.

test_results.input: Compare the strategies employers use to manage public holidays with employee rights and trading restrictions.
test_results.actual_output: I can't provide a detailed comparison of strategies employers use to manage public holidays with employee rights and trading restrictions, as the specific information is not available in the provided sources. If you have any other questions related to small business services and support, feel free to ask!
test_results.expected_output: Employers manage public holidays by ensuring compliance with employee rights and trading restrictions. Employee rights typically include entitlements to paid leave on public holidays or alternative holidays if they are required to work. Employers must also consider transferring public holidays to other days if necessary, especially when a holiday falls on a weekend. Trading restrictions, such as those on Easter Sunday, require some businesses to close or limit operations, impacting how employers plan staffing and operations during these times. Balancing these factors involves strategic scheduling and clear communication with employees to ensure both legal compliance and business continuity.

test_results.input: If Callaghan Innovation were to expand globally, how might its mission to foster bold, innovative entrepreneurs and world-bettering companies evolve?
test_results.actual_output: I'm sorry, but I can't provide information on hypothetical scenarios or expansions of Callaghan Innovation beyond the current scope of available data. If you have questions about Callaghan Innovation's current services or support for New Zealand businesses, feel free to ask!
test_results.expected_output: If Callaghan Innovation were to expand globally, its mission to foster bold, innovative entrepreneurs and world-bettering companies might evolve by adapting its strategies to diverse international markets. This could involve collaborating with global partners to support innovation across different cultural and economic contexts, enhancing its focus on diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging on a global scale, and leveraging its expertise in areas like medicinal cannabis to address global challenges. Additionally, Callaghan Innovation might expand its support for indigenous businesses, like Pakihi Māori, to include indigenous entrepreneurs worldwide, thereby fostering a more inclusive and innovative global entrepreneurial ecosystem.

test_results.input: Explore strategic partnerships for leveraging R&D facilities to enhance innovation and productivity.
test_results.actual_output:
To explore strategic partnerships for leveraging R&D facilities to enhance innovation and productivity, you can consider the following approaches based on the available sources:

1. **Utilise Innovation Networks**: Leverage extensive connections across New Zealand's innovation network to find the right collaborators and resources. This can help advance your ideas and projects by connecting with experts and facilities that align with your goals [ai-activator-to-support-rapid-adoption-of-transformative-ai-technologies.html].

2. **Access World-Class R&D Facilities**: Take advantage of world-class problem-solving expertise and R&D facilities available through these networks. These resources can help you overcome technical challenges and elevate your innovations to the next level [ai-activator.html].

3. **Funding and Support for R&D Initiatives**: Seek funding and support for specific innovation and R&D initiatives. This can include talent recruitment and product development, which are crucial for enhancing productivity and innovation [ai-e-learning-modules.html].

4. **Identify Opportunities for Innovation**: Work with partners to spot opportunities to innovate and increase productivity. Setting clear goals and obtaining necessary training can further support your business growth and success [ai-activator-to-support-rapid-adoption-of-transformative-ai-technologies.html].

These strategies can help you effectively leverage R&D facilities and partnerships to boost innovation and productivity. Please note that this list is non-exhaustive, and further exploration of available resources and networks is recommended.
test_results.expected_output: We offer strategic partnerships that provide access to world-class problem-solving expertise and R&D facilities. These partnerships are designed to help you overcome technical challenges, enhance innovation, and boost productivity. By collaborating with us, you can leverage our resources to spot opportunities for innovation, set goals, and receive the necessary training for long-term success.

test_results.input: If family violence leave policies were suddenly expanded to cover more scenarios, how might this affect workplace dynamics and employee support systems?
test_results.actual_output:
If family violence leave policies were expanded to cover more scenarios, it could have several impacts on workplace dynamics and employee support systems:

1. **Increased Support for Employees**: Expanding the scenarios covered by family violence leave would likely enhance the support available to employees affected by family violence. This could include more comprehensive leave options and flexible working arrangements, which are crucial for those dealing with such situations [taking-family-violence-leave.html].

2. **Workplace Policy Adjustments**: Employers might need to update their existing workplace policies to accommodate the expanded leave scenarios. This could involve revising leave and holidays policies, as well as flexible work policies, to ensure they align with the new requirements [managing-family-violence-leave.html].

3. **Impact on Customer Demand**: There might be a negative impact on the ability to meet customer demand if more employees take leave under the expanded policies. Employers would need to plan for potential disruptions and find ways to manage workloads effectively [managing-family-violence-leave.html].

4. **Improved Workplace Relationships**: Having clear and supportive policies in place can help build good working relationships between employers and employees. It simplifies handling the effects of family violence and ensures that employees are not treated adversely due to their circumstances [managing-family-violence-leave.html].

These points are non-exhaustive and would depend on the specific changes made to the policies.
test_results.expected_output: Expanding family violence leave policies to cover more scenarios could significantly impact workplace dynamics and employee support systems. It would likely increase awareness and sensitivity towards family violence issues within the workplace, fostering a more supportive and understanding environment. Employees might feel more secure and valued, knowing they have the necessary support during difficult times. This could lead to improved morale and productivity as employees are less stressed about balancing personal crises with work responsibilities. Additionally, HR departments might need to enhance their support systems and training to effectively manage the increased scope of leave requests and ensure that all employees are treated fairly and with empathy.

Developing workplace policies                                   As an employer, you should have workplace policies in place that provide support for employees affected by family violence.                                   For example, you could:                       	             create a family violence policy that sets out how you will support employees who are affected by family violence             	             update existing leave and holidays policies, as well as flexible work policies             	             make changes at work to ensure staff affected by family violence are not treated adversely.                                     Having clear policies helps build good working relationships between workers and employers. They make it simpler for both you and your employees to handle the effects of family violence.                                   Create a family violence policy using Workplace Policy Builder.                                                Workplace Policy Builder - Business.govt.nz                           (external link)                                                                         Workplace policies and procedures                                                                       	                       Published:                                  11 Mar 2024

taking-family-violence-leave.html: place.                                                                        Family violence leave guide                                                            Employee privacy                                                                                                                                                      Note                                                       Family violence, also known as domestic violence, means all forms of violence in family and intimate relationships. It can be physical, sexual or psychological abuse.                                                                                           Other rights employees have                                   If you are affected by family violence you also have the right to:                       	             ask for short-term flexible working arrangements for up to 2 months             	             not be treated adversely (badly) in the workplace because you might have experienced family violence.                                     You still have these rights if you experienced family violence before you began working for your current employer or before the law changed on 1 April 2019.
